    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Main start method of the program. SkipNodeDatabase is configured by reading from database lineup file (plain text file). According to the configuration, visualization of the Skip Graph is done.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        SkipNodeDatabase, setScene(ScrollPane, VBox, HBox, SkipNodeDatabase)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • setScene

        public void setScene(javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane sp,
                     javafx.scene.layout.VBox root,
                     javafx.scene.layout.HBox buttons,
                     SkipNodeDatabase db)
              throws BitMissMatchException
        Puts everything that is necessary for the visualization and controlling the visualization on the scene.
        Parameters:
        sp - the scrollpane the database visualization would go onto
        root - is the main box everything goes in
        buttons - is the HBox that all the buttons ie. add, switch goes on
        db - is the database that is to be visualized
        Throws:
        BitMissMatchException
        See Also:
        nextLayer(int, SkipNodeDatabase, Color), reset(SkipNodeDatabase, VBox)

      • reset

        public void reset(SkipNodeDatabase db,
                  javafx.scene.layout.VBox vb)
        This function erases the skipnode visualization that is in the ScrollPane sp and replaces it with the updated values
        Parameters:
        db - with the updated information db (the database array that was initially being visualised) is placed onto the scrollpane
        vb - is the vbox that is in the scrollpane that stores all the layers of the given database
        See Also:
        nextLayer(int, SkipNodeDatabase, Color)

      • nextLayer

        public void nextLayer(int layer,
                      SkipNodeDatabase db,
                      javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Takes a SkipNodeDatabase and visualises the indicated layer (level) by given color. Each node is illustrated by a Button whose height is 40 pixels, but width is determined by maxButtonsize. All nodes on the same layer are connected to each other with and each node is created by the method create(SkipNode, int).
        Parameters:
        layer - is the level that is to be visualized next
        db - is the skipnode that is to be visualized
        color - connections at each level have different colors to help with distinguishing
        See Also:
        create(SkipNode, int)

      • create

        public javafx.scene.control.Button create(SkipNode n,
                                          int level)
        Creates buttons that will represent a node at a level with a Button.
        Parameters:
        n - is the node that is to be represented by the button
        level - is the level of n this button will represent
        Returns:
        Button is the visualized version of a node
        See Also:
        is used to display numericalID, nameID and level (layer), Button
